title: Salahmu
author: Salahmu
content: The rate at which other altcoins are competiting with btc even when Bitcoin is the most reliable cryptocurrency in the market but though considering how far the price has gone, so many investors prefer other smaller altcoins to invest because of scared to lose money, so they prefer a good potential and chipper coins rather than investing on Bitcoin, with the current price of btc investors that has a laser amounts of money will be scared to invest because any slightest negative move affects the capital, take for instance you have $3k for investment and let say btc price is at $30k would you invest knowing that any negative moves affects your capital deeply?, though the market will surely bounce back but the level of profit will be very small but in times of other altcoins that has a low price should be more profitable were as any fluctuation will not seriously affect your capital. I no that Bitcoin is the master of all coins and other coins can fail but btc can never failed, but majority of people are going for more smaller coins. I'm not an investment adviser that will tell you what coins to invest I only stated my observation why most people consider smaller altcoins rather than btc but I may also be wrong with my observation so please share your views I'm here to learn.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: Don't be deceived with the price of altcoins because that is what newbies are people who don't understand cryptocurrency look at. Price shouldn't be a criterion when you are investing and getting quick profit shouldn't be what you put in your mind. Anything that has high profit and very cheap to buy wi not last as it will put you in a big loss. That is why you should think wisely and settle down for something unique and with great potential which is bitcoin. With bitcoin,you can be assured that you will make profit in the long run based on the amount that you invested. Don't be deceived with the price of altcoins and make sure you understand the market before investing on them. I don't think I have ever thought of any altcoin to invest in. Bitcoin price is volatile that is why you see the pump and dump in its price. It is a better to buy a small fraction of bitcoin and hodli than to buy a big fraction of shitcoin that can dump to zero level at anytime.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on August 01, 2023, 11:51:41 PMconsidering how far the price has gone, so many investors prefer other smaller altcoins to invest because of scared to lose money, so they prefer a good potential and chipper coins rather than investing on Bitcoin, @OP, even the coins that you or other people think are cheap enough that you end up Investing in them might even be the Altcoin that results in a lost fund, because some times, you can see an altcoin project looking so real that you can go through their white paper and their website and everything will look legit to you. The project can even go as far as listing the token on some known exchanges like Probit, Lbank, MEXC, Pancake Swap, etc. But all that, doesn't really guarantee that that project can be profitable. There are thousands of Altcoins in the crypto space, and a lot of them are competing among themselves, but Bitcoin is incomparable to any of them. Perhaps those Altcoins you see out there are either built on the Ethereum or Binance networks. Bitcoin is on its own blockchain, and as such, altcoins are not in competition with it.

comments.body: If you invest in Bitcoin or altcoins, you cannot guarantee that you will profit 100% of the time. Some investors buy altcoins because they are economical. Bitcoin may continue to be the dominant cryptocurrency in the market for some time. This is due to the fact that it is both the face of the cryptocurrency industry and the most expensive crypto-asset to date.There would not have been an altcoin market in the first place if Bitcoin had not attained its initial success. Bitcoin set the door for the development of altcoins.  Bitcoin is the most abundant money and has the most backing. As for me, Is better to invest in Bitcoin because i trust the coin.

Point of correction my friend, I must say you are totally wrong on this very concept of yours, as both the price of Bitcoin & altcoin move in respect to percentage (%), which even if it's a huge capital or smaller capital you invest in either of these two coin, the profit or loss you may make is directly proportional to what percentage the price of the coin you invested in moves. For example;1. Assume your capital is $3000, and you invested that amount in Bitcoin, and let's say the value of Bitcoin than rises by 10% your profit will be,10/100 x $3000 = $300, and means the available balance you will be having in your wallet will be $3300 (i.e an addition of $300)But if by mistake, then the price of Bitcoin happens to fall by that same 10%, then your available balance will be; $3000 - $300 = $2700   (i.e a subtraction of $300)And same goes to altcoin, but just that altcoin have a high volatility more than BTC

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on August 01, 2023, 11:51:41 PMI'm not an investment adviser that will tell you what coins to invest I only stated my observation why most people consider smaller altcoins rather than btc but I may also be wrong with my observation so please share your views I'm here to learn. Your topic should have just been bitcoin vs altcoins and not “other altcoins”. By saying other altcoins, you’re already referring to that some alt coins are superior over the others. This could be true but in true sense and as a bitcoin enthusiast that you are, bitcoin should be treated differently from other altcoins and shouldn’t be interchanged or interpreted wrongly with them. We see bitcoin as the only dependable coin and every other ones as centralized and undependable coins. The ulterior motive of most of them is to earn profit from people’s investments in them, once they achieve their goal, most of them exit the market and cook up another altcoin to lure people into again. Only few altcoins survive market volatility, investing in the existing altcoins in the market pose great risk and should be done at caution.
